timeline.bodyText:
My feeling would be (not because it's important right here, more as a matter principle) that InitComponents might rather be
"protected JPanel createMainPanel() { ... }"
Everything from "add(middlePanel..." to center() (lines 71-77) would then move to the AbstractGCD and in the subclass it would just "return middlePanel;" instead. In this way the subclass can create whatever it wants in that panel and just return it and it does not have to "remember" doing anything (e.g. to createButtons()).
Of course, this forces createbuttons() on the subclasses but I suppose that's the buttons we need for a game conection dialog...
I mean this purely as a suggestion.
timeline.author: SJuliez

replies.bodyText: I concur, that's better code. Implement.
